However, the Domme continued after the safe word was triggered, causing significant pain and possible injury. The person then didn't pay the remaining amount and went to the hospital.

The individual's right to their body and safety is paramount. So not paying in this case could be justified as the service provided was hazardous and violated the terms they agreed upon.

Therefore, the answer would be B, the author is not in the wrong. They prioritized their safety and health, which is essential in any consensual activity. The Domme failed to uphold her part of the agreement by ignoring the safe word, making her the one at fault here.
